description: Dive into "Capturing Kanyakumari: A Photographic Journey" ‚Äî a handpicked list of places with quick notes, links, and essentials for fast trip planning and discovery.
title: Capturing Kanyakumari: A Photographic Journey

places.generalDescription: Sunset Point, Kanyakumari is a renowned vantage point at the southernmost tip of India, offering stunning views of the sun setting over the meeting point of the Arabian Sea, Bay of Bengal, and Indian Ocean. Visitors flock to this spot for its mesmerizing sunsets and picturesque scenery. The clean beach provides an ideal setting for a leisurely stroll while witnessing the breathtaking sunset.

sources.snippet: Sunset Point Kanyakumari is a popular vantage point located in the southernmost tip of India, offering breathtaking views of the sun setting over the confluence of the Arabian Sea, the Bay of Bengal, and the Indian Ocean. Known for its mesmerizing sunsets, the point attracts tourists and locals alike, who gather to witness the spectacular display of colors in the sky.
sources.shortName: 21 Places to Visit in Kanyakumari in 2024

places.name: Sunset Point, Kanyakumari

reviews.text: Sunset view at Kanyakumari is truly magical! A very spacious area with good parking facilities. Street food adds to the experience. A peaceful and beautiful place to relax and enjoy nature's beauty. Must visit for a memorable evening!

It is one of the beautiful places to visit. You can come in a four Wheeler and/or two wheeler to the place, as you have decent parking space.
It's better if you come during the sunrise and sunset, either on sixt in the morning or around six  in the evening you can really enjoy the breathtaking view of the sun do.It with your family, and you could have a very good memory.
Remember, there could be huge crowd when you visit during the weekend. So watch out when you are visiting. So if you could visit here during the we weekdays, it's more good, however, if you are available only during the weekend, ensure you carry adequate food, water and snacks.

2. üåÖ Sunset today around 6:35 PM

3. üåä You can see sea waves  clearly

places.generalDescription: Vivekananda Rock Memorial is a sacred monument dedicated to Hindu monk Swami Vivekananda, located on a rock in the sea. It is believed that Swami Vivekananda attained enlightenment after meditating on this rock. The site also holds significance as the place where Goddess Parvati did penance for Lord Shiva.

sources.snippet: Vivekananda Rock Memorial built in memory of Swami Vivekananda, is set in such a picturesque setting that you‚Äôd want to linger on in the place for a longer time. The Memorial consists of a Mandapam which has a life sized idol of Swami Vivekananda and a meditation hall where one can sit in quiet contemplation. Facing the Mandapam is another mandapam called Sri Padaparai with a rock in the sanctum, which has the raised impression of a footprint, which according to legends was made by Goddess Kanyakumari.
sources.shortName: Tourist Places To Visit In Kanyakumari (2025)

sources.snippet: Built-in the memory of the great religious reformer, Swami Vivekananda, Vivekananda Rock Memorial is one of the top attractions of Kanyakumari that must be on your bucket list. Comprising two main structures -the Vivekananda Mandapam and the Shripada Mandapam, this historical monument in Kanyakumari is an architectural wonder which is approximately 500 meters away from the mainland. The life-size statue of Swami Vivekananda is the most attractive feature of the memorial which was inaugurated in 1970.
sources.shortName: Top 7 Attractions of Kanyakumari | Azure Waters & Picture Perfect Sunsets

sources.snippet: Revered Indian poet and Hindu philosopher Swami Vivekananda visited Kanyakumari in 1892, towards the end of an extensive trip across India as a wandering monk. His transformation into an influential leader and reformer is attributed to the three days he spent meditating on a large offshore rock, where Goddess Kanya Kumari is said to have carried out part of her penance by standing on one foot. According to ancient Hindu texts, the Puranas, the rock was blessed by the touch of her foot.
sources.shortName: Top Things to Do in Kanyakumari, Tamil Nadu

sources.snippet: Dedicated to Swami Vivekananda, a religious reformer, the Vivekananda Rock Memorial is one of the most popular tourist attraction in Kanyakumari. Covering an area of six acres, the rock memorial is situated at an island a few metres into the sea and positioned at a level of 17 metres above the sea level. Apart from that, a statue of celebrated Tamil poet, Thiruvalluvar, standing tall, almost at the confluence of the three seas, is a major tourist place.
sources.shortName: Kanyakumari Tourism- Best Places to Visit in Kanyakumari

sources.snippet: The magnificent Vivekananda Rock Memorial, situated just at the merger of the beautiful Arabian Sea, Bay of Bengal and Indian ocean is one of the major locations of Kanyakumari and Tamil Nadu. It is dedicated to the greatest philosopher of the century Swami Vivekananda, as it is said that Vivekananda got enlightenment while he was meditating on this rock in his early monk days. It is located exactly on a rock amidst the sea, where you can reach by boat.
sources.shortName: Aesthetic Pre Wedding Photoshoot in Kanyakumari

sources.snippet: One of the iconic monuments in Kanyakumari, the Vivekananda Rock Memorial is located 100 meters from the shore and is one of the major tourist attractions in Kanyakumari. The small rock island can be reached by a ferry and consists of two main structures. The Vivekananda Mandapam and the Shripada Mandapam are the two main complexes of the memorial and is frequented by thousands of tourists.
sources.shortName: Top 5 Places To Visit In Kanyakumari

sources.snippet: The magnificent Vivekananda Rock Memorial can be seen on a small island off Kanyakumari. It has the picturesque Indian Ocean in its backdrop and hence serves as a peaceful and serene destination for visitors from all across the globe. It is situated on one of the two adjacent rocks protruding out of the Lakshadweep Sea and constitutes the ‚ÄòShripada Mandapam‚Äô and the ‚ÄòVivekananda Mandapam‚Äô.
sources.shortName: 5 Best Places to visit in Kanyakumari

sources.snippet: The Vivekananda Rock Memorial stands on a rocky island about half a kilometer from shore line and is one of the most famous landmarks in Kanyakumari. Constructed in 1970 as tribute to Swami Vivekananda, the monument provides wide views towards the surrounding sea. The early morning rays cast magic upon this building making it very photogenic.
sources.shortName: Discover Kanyakumaris Top Spots Through The Lens Of A Photographer

sources.snippet: Another popular place to see in Kanyakumari is the Vivekananda Rock Memorial. This rock is situated 500 meters away from the mainland and can be reached via ferry that operates at regularly intervals. Vivekananda Rock Memorial was built in 1970, in the honor of great Indian saint Swami Vivekananda, who has visited Kanyakumari in 1892.
sources.shortName: Places to visit in Kanyakumari

sources.snippet: One of the most recognizable sites in Kanyakumari is the Vivekananda Rock Memorial. This memorial, which is perched on a rock island, honors Swami Vivekananda, who is reported to have meditated there. The memorial‚Äôs majestic architecture and breathtaking sea view make it the ideal location for enchanting pre-wedding photos.
sources.shortName: Best Pre-Wedding Shoot Locations in Kanyakumari: Capture Your Love Story

sources.snippet: Vivekananda Rock Memorial is a well-known tourist monument placed in Vavathurai, Kanyakumari, India. The memorial stands on one of the two rocks, about 500 metres away from India's southern most tip. It was constructed in honour of Swami Vivekananda who is said to have attained enlightenment on this rock.
sources.shortName: 26 Best Places to visit in Kanyakumari | Top Tourist Attractions

sources.snippet: Vivekananda Rock Memorial is the major attraction of Vavathurai, Kanyakumari, India. it was built in 1970 in honor of Swami Vivekananda who is said to have earned enlightenment on the rock. The memorial stands on one of 2 rocks situated about five hundred meters off the mainland of Vavathurai.
sources.shortName: Top Tourist Places in Kanyakumari

sources.snippet: Located super close to the shore, the Vivekananda Rock Memorial is one of the most iconic spots in Kanyakumari. You can take the ferry and reach the memorial. Frequented by thousands of tourists, this memorial has a plethora of gorgeous spaces and is as tranquil as it gets.
sources.shortName: Best Places To Visit In Kanyakumari

sources.snippet: Vivekananda Rock Memorial was built as a mark of respect to the legendary Swami Vivekananda in 1970. It is one of the major places to visit in Kanyakumari. Swamiji attained enlightenment at this place while sitting on a rock and meditating.
sources.shortName: 25 Places to Visit in Kanyakumari, Tourist Places & Attractions

sources.snippet: At a distance of 1.5 km from Kanyakumari Bus Station & 1.5 km from Kanyakumari Railway Station, Vivekananda Rock Memorial is a memorial located on a small island off Kanyakumari. It is one of the picturesque Kanyakumari places to visit.
sources.shortName: 35 Best Places to Visit in Kanyakumari, Things to Do & Sightseeing (2024)

sources.snippet: The coastal city is famously known for the magnificent Vivekananda Rock Memorial. But apart from that, there are several exquisite locales and places to visit in Kanyakumari that tourists can enjoy during the trip!
sources.shortName: Top 20 Places to Visit in Kanyakumari: Best kanyakumari Tourist Places

sources.snippet: One of the top places to visit in Kanyakumari is the Vivekananda Rock Monument, which can be seen on a nearby island. In 1892, after three days of meditation, Swami Vivekananda found enlightenment here.
sources.shortName: 21 Places to Visit in Kanyakumari in 2024

sources.snippet: Amaze yourself by witnessing the Vivekananda Rock Memorial in Kanyakumari. Swami Vivekananda achieved enlightenment at this place. Vivekananda Rock Memorial was founded in 1970 to honor Swamiji.
sources.shortName: 10 Places to Visit in Kanyakumari: A Serene Getaway

places.name: Vivekananda Rock Memorial

reviews.text: Good tourist spot. Price was reasonable. Week days were not crowded. Boat service was good but the life jacket could have maintained properly. The glass bridge was mesmerizing.

Vivekananda Rock Memorial ‚Äì Beautiful, But Be Prepared

The Vivekananda Rock Memorial is undoubtedly a serene and inspiring place, rich in history and spiritual significance. The view from the rock, surrounded by the endless sea and with the mainland in the distance, is truly breathtaking. It's a powerful spot where you can reflect and feel deeply connected to nature and Swami Vivekananda's legacy.

However, the experience getting there was less than ideal. Despite purchasing the ‚Çπ300 ferry ticket, we still had to stand in a long, exhausting queue under the scorching sun, with minimal shade or crowd management. It was quite frustrating, especially considering the premium ticket.

Additionally, there's a separate entrance fee for the temple once you reach the rock, which felt a bit excessive after already paying for the ferry ride. The heat and waiting time took away from the peacefulness we were hoping for.

Tips:

Carry a hat, sunglasses, and water - the sun can be relentless.
Try to visit early in the morning to avoid both the heat and long queues.
Be mentally prepared for the wait, even with a higher-priced ticket.
It's a must-see spot for its spiritual and scenic value, but a bit of planning (and patience) is necessary to truly enjoy it.

The very sight of Vivekananda Rock from a distance fills you with a deep sense of peace and awe. Once you arrive, be prepared for a wait - even on weekdays, the queue can take around 45 minutes. You can choose between ‚Çπ100 or ‚Çπ300 tickets depending on your preference, but whichever you choose, the journey is well worth it.

Once you're there, the calm of the rock, the spiritual energy of the place, the stunning architecture of the memorial, and the majestic Tiruvalluvar statue leave a lasting impression. The glass bridge adds a unique touch to the experience.

Note: There are no food stalls on the premises, so plan your visit after a hearty breakfast or lunch. Free drinking water is available, and there's a small shop where you can buy books and souvenirs to take a part of the experience home.

A must-visit for those seeking serenity, inspiration, and a connection with India's spiritual legacy.

places.generalDescription: Sunrise Point, located in Kanyakumari, is a popular spot that offers a vibrant and colorful view of the surroundings. The area is bustling with tourists, locals, pilgrims, and vendors from all walks of life. From this viewpoint, visitors can witness the breathtaking sight of Swami Vivekananda's statue against the backdrop of the sun rising over the sea. Kanyakumari itself is renowned for its stunning sunrises and sunsets, particularly on full moon days.

sources.snippet: Located in the southern-most tip of the Indian Peninsula, the Sunrise Point provides the most spectacular view of the sunrise and sunset. From this point, you can see the confluence of all three oceans (the Arabian Sea, Bay of Bengal andthe Indian Ocean) and it‚Äôs romantic max!. The best time to visit is 5:30am.
sources.shortName: Best Places To Visit In Kanyakumari

sources.snippet: At a distance of 2 km from Kanyakumari Bus Station, Sunrise Point is a spectacular view point located in Kanyakumari. It is one of the most attractive places to visit in Kanyakumari.
sources.shortName: 35 Best Places to Visit in Kanyakumari, Things to Do & Sightseeing (2024)

places.name: Sunrise Point

reviews.text:
Amazing experience!! I waited for an hour to see the magic..it seems like another planet closer to me and can happened anything in that moment...
My friend missed this and choose the bed because we slept by 2 in the night and I choose 2 hour sleep and this is the rest...woh feeling ki India ke last point pe khada hoon aur ab yahan se kuch aur shuru hoga was new feeling for a boy who loves travel but didn't traveled much..
2017.

One of the famous and popular spot for tourists. One will be get so excited for the glimpse of few minutes sunrise view. Early morning alarms, looking for best spots, searching for high rise hotels for best view, prior Reece of the place for identifying best place. We were not lucky enough that day as it was raining for the past one week and it was cloudy in the morning. Enjoyed night view and early morning sea waves and pleasant weather. Must visit place

Sunrise Point, located parallel to the iconic Vivekananda Rock, is truly a serene and beautiful spot. As the last accessible point of the Indian mainland, it offers a peaceful ambiance and stunning views that make the experience unforgettable.

We visited the place in the evening and were captivated by the calm surroundings and the gentle sound of the waves. The natural beauty of the location creates a perfect moment of reflection and stillness.

However, visitors should tread carefully ‚Äì the path is made of irregular stone boulders, which can be uneven and tricky to walk on, especially in low light. Comfortable footwear and caution are a must.

We plan to return tomorrow morning to witness the sunrise from this tranquil spot - we've heard it's a magical sight not to be missed.

places.address: 3HJ2+XWV, Vavaturai Beach Rd, Kanniyakumari, Tamil Nadu, India

places.generalDescription: Triveni Sangamam, located in Kanyakumari, is a significant Hindu pilgrimage site where the Ganges and Yamuna rivers intersect. This place holds great cultural and historical importance, having been ruled by various dynasties for thousands of years. The confluence of the Indian Ocean, Bay of Bengal, and Arabian Sea at Triveni Sangam offers a breathtaking view of the sunset and is considered holy by deities visiting the Kanyakumari temple.

sources.snippet: The remarkable confluence where the oceans merge, known as Triveni Sangam, is considered to be powerful and sacred. A dip in the water is said to wash away all sins and provide liberation from the cycle of rebirth. Even if you don't want to participate in the ritual, it's still worth spending some time at this unique place and contemplating its essence.
sources.shortName: Top Things to Do in Kanyakumari, Tamil Nadu

sources.snippet: Do not forget to add Triveni Sangam to your Kanyakumari itinerary. It will be a lifelong experience for you to witness and experience this spectacular place. The congregation of the Arabian Sea, the Bay of Bengal, and the Indian Ocean is a picture-perfect sight to behold.
sources.shortName: 10 Places to Visit in Kanyakumari: A Serene Getaway

sources.snippet: Triveni Sangam in Kanyakumari is a unique convergence where three bodies of water meet, symbolizing harmony amidst diversity. Here, the waters of the Arabian Sea, Bay of Bengal, and Indian Ocean blend seamlessly, creating a mesmerizing sight.
sources.shortName: 25 Places to Visit in Kanyakumari, Tourist Places & Attractions

places.name: Triveni Sangamam

reviews.text:
Kanyakumari is extremely beautiful. It's surrounded by the sea with amazing views of the open sky. I absolutely loved visiting here.

You can enjoy both sunrise and sunset here. It's mind blowing how fantastic this place is. You can just sit and enjoy the cool breeze. Admire the sky, sea and nature.

I wish to visit here again and again and spend time with my loved ones here.

It's the point where Arabian Sea and Bay of Bengal meet with Indian Ocean. Very crowded. Have to enter through the way of temple entry. Lots of people speaks Hindi so no language issue to communicate.Nice sea breeze to enjoy with family. Local shops are there. Police should manage the crowd well. Overall nice.

places.generalDescription: When visiting Kanyakumari, experiencing the breathtaking views at Sunrise & Sunset Point is an absolute must. These iconic spots offer a mesmerizing display of nature as the sun rises and sets over the horizon, creating a stunning canvas of colors that will leave you in awe. The beach serves as the perfect backdrop for witnessing dawn's first light, while the View Tower provides an exceptional vantage point for sunset enthusiasts.

sources.snippet: Priceless sunrises and sunsets, on Kanyakumari's watery horizon, are among the finest in India. Sunrise, alongside the Thiruvalluvar statue, is arguably the most majestic of the two. However, sunsets are particularly special on full moon nights, when the moon rises from the sea opposite the setting sun at about the same time.
sources.shortName: Top Things to Do in Kanyakumari, Tamil Nadu

places.name: Kanniyakumari view

reviews.text:
Amazing view, the sunrise is good and mesmerizing, view point is inside the see. You can walk to the view point. Wakeup in the morning stayed near to the view point, walkable distance from the hotel. Went around 5.30 am morning. No waiting, we can go to the last point waited for the sun to rise. It will take around 30 to 60 minutes wait. Depends on the wether. If wether is clear you can see the beautiful view of sunrise.

If this review is helpful to you , you can like this review. Thank you.
Excellent for photography lovers. Fantastic view of Vivekananda Rock memorial and Kanyakumari township. Great place for evening walk. It is safe but should avoid during High winds.

This sunrise view point of kanyakumari is magnificent. You can see mesmerising view of rising sun along with sea bay of Bengal. You can sit on the rocks and enjoy the sunrise. I will suggest you to go little far in this path than you can enjoy a good sunrise with a good and awesome pictures at the end

places.generalDescription: Sri Kanniyakumari Amman Temple is an ancient and ornate Hindu temple dedicated to the goddess Kumari. It is a significant pilgrimage site in Kanyakumari, offering visitors a spiritual experience amidst its Dravidian-style architecture and colorful ornamental pillars. The temple is famous for the dazzling diamond nose ring adorning the deity, which has been said to lead sailors astray due to its brightness.

sources.snippet: Attend a midnight mass at the Our Lady of Ransom Church or offer prayers at the Bhagavathy Amman Temple, you are bound to feel blessed. History buffs can have a good time at Kanyakumari Wax Museum or exploring the Vattakottai Fort. In our effort to guide tourists in Kanyakumari we have given all the details about the places to visit and things to do in our Kanyakumari Travel Guide that can also help you with how to reach and best time to go.
sources.shortName: Kanyakumari Tourism- Best Places to Visit in Kanyakumari

sources.snippet: At number 5th, we have the most famous temple of Kanyakumari, the one and only Kumari Amman Temple, also known as the Kanyakumari temple. This temple resembles Devi Kanyakumari herself and is one of the historic(Vedic period) and sacred places in the world .Did you know that it has also been mentioned in Ramayana and Mahabharata?. Kanyakumari temple is situated just along the sea presenting great scenic beauty.
sources.shortName: Aesthetic Pre Wedding Photoshoot in Kanyakumari

sources.snippet: Bhagavathy Amman Temple is a 3000 years old temple dedicated to the Goddess Kanyakumari Amman. The temple is significant in hosting the ancient scriptures of the epics Ramayana and Mahabharata and the religious Vedas. It is considered as one of the auspicious places to visit in Kanyakumari.
sources.shortName: 25 Places to Visit in Kanyakumari, Tourist Places & Attractions

sources.snippet: The south of India is blessed with many temples and religious places. Kanyakumari also has beautiful temples with Devi Kanyakumari temple being the most famous one. It is known to be one of the 108 shaktipeeths in India and is also about 3000 years old.
sources.shortName: Top 20 Places to Visit in Kanyakumari: Best kanyakumari Tourist Places

sources.snippet: Do you want to purify your mind, body, and soul during your Kanyakumari trip?. Then, you should not miss visiting the Bhagavathy Amman Temple. This famous temple is dedicated to Goddess Bhagavathy Amman (also known as Devi Kanyakumari).
sources.shortName: 10 Places to Visit in Kanyakumari: A Serene Getaway

sources.snippet: It is one of the most revered heritage places in Kanyakumari. The Kumari Amman Temple, which is located in Kanyakumari and is considered to be one of the 51 shakti peeths, has a history that goes back further than three thousand years.
sources.shortName: 21 Places to Visit in Kanyakumari in 2024

places.name: Arulmigu Devi Kanniyakumari Baghavathi Amman Temple

reviews.text: Amazing temple!! You need to pay anyone anything. Just walk in to have a blessed darshan!!. Men will have to open their shirts. The temple is old, and the idol is amazing. The nose ring, which is the highlight, shines in all glory!! History has it that ships used to steer to coast seeing the shine of the nose ring!! It's really worth visiting. Views from behind temples are also good!

The temple is about 1 to 2 km from the railway station-easy to reach by walk or auto. Don't miss the beautiful sunrise at Kanyakumari-it's a must-see!

The deity here is very powerful and divine. For male devotees, shirts or T-shirts are not allowed inside the temple. Only dhoti or pants are allowed, and the upper body must be uncovered.

There are both free and paid darshan options available. For fresh-up, there are many clock rooms and fresh-up rooms nearby. No need to spend much on rooms-basic fresh-up facilities are available for just ‚Çπ30.

A peaceful and powerful place to visit with spiritual energy all around.

places.generalDescription: Our Lady of Ransom Shrine, also known as Lady of Ransom Church, is a stunning Catholic church located in Kanyakumari. The Gothic Revival architectural style of the pearl-white exterior makes it a captivating sight for visitors. The church features simple stained glasswork on its doors and windows, a gold altar adorned with a statue of Mother Mary, intricately carved idols of Christ, disciples, and soldiers.

sources.snippet: Attend a midnight mass at the Our Lady of Ransom Church or offer prayers at the Bhagavathy Amman Temple, you are bound to feel blessed. History buffs can have a good time at Kanyakumari Wax Museum or exploring the Vattakottai Fort. In our effort to guide tourists in Kanyakumari we have given all the details about the places to visit and things to do in our Kanyakumari Travel Guide that can also help you with how to reach and best time to go.
sources.shortName: Kanyakumari Tourism- Best Places to Visit in Kanyakumari

sources.snippet: Another good photography location is Our Lady of Ransom Church, which has gothic architecture and a calm environment. The church devoted to St. Mary showcases exquisite stained glass windows, ornate altars, and a beautiful fa ade. There are architectural details that photographers can take advantage of, light coming through stained glass windows as well as its serene environment.
sources.shortName: Discover Kanyakumaris Top Spots Through The Lens Of A Photographer

sources.snippet: Our Lady of Ransom Church is one of the best architectural places to see in Kanyakumari. Built during the 15th century with the Gothic style of architecture, it is dedicated to Mother Mary. The walls and the ceilings contain the exquisite carvings of the 12 disciples of Christ, angels playing musical instruments and wooden carvings depicting the coronation of Mother Mary.
sources.shortName: 25 Places to Visit in Kanyakumari, Tourist Places & Attractions

sources.snippet: It's not just Dravidian-styled temple architecture that would enthral you but also some gothic-style churches!. While you're in the city, you should visit Our Lady of Ransom Church for its vintage setting and gorgeous views. The church is also located at a walking distance from the marvellous beach.
sources.shortName: Top 20 Places to Visit in Kanyakumari: Best kanyakumari Tourist Places

sources.snippet: Our Lady of Ransom Church in Tamil Nadu, built in the 15th century, is a church known for its stunning Gothic architecture. Dedicated to Mother Mary, it stands majestically against the ocean backdrop, with its gold cross, white spires, and stained glass windows enhancing its beauty.
sources.shortName: 21 Places to Visit in Kanyakumari in 2024

sources.snippet: At a distance of 2 km from Kanyakumari Bus Station, Our Lady of Ransom Church is a Catholic church located at Kanyakumari, Tamil Nadu, India. It is one of the prominent churches in Tamil Nadu, and among the must-include places in Kanyakumari pilgrimage tour.
sources.shortName: 35 Best Places to Visit in Kanyakumari, Things to Do & Sightseeing (2024)

places.name: Shrine of Our Lady of Ransom

reviews.text: I visited this church recently. It is very beautiful and very nice. The church is located at the sea shore near Kanyakumari. I went inside the church to pray and it was so peaceful. There was a gentle breeze as I was enjoying the calm environment. Birds were chirping and I loved it. You can definitely visit the historic place and enjoy some peaceful time there ‚ù£Ô∏è

A serene oasis! Our Lady of Ransom Shrine is a haven of peace and spirituality. The cleanliness and ambiance inside the church are truly uplifting. A wonderful place for reflection and prayer. Highly recommended for those seeking solace and tranquility.‚ú®üåü

Visited on today morning. A small thatched church was upgraded in 1700 when a big church of Roman architecture was constructed. A statue of Mother Mary was created in the 16th century derived in Rome. The statue, clad with a sari, was placed in the centre of a golden altar .¬†Statues of St. Joseph and St. Francis Xavier were placed in the right side and left side respectively

places.generalDescription: Sunset View Point in Kanyakumari is renowned for offering one of the most captivating sunset views in the world. Situated at the confluence of three water bodies, it provides a serene and tranquil atmosphere that attracts photographers and tourists from across the globe. The dedicated spot allows visitors to sit and enjoy the breathtaking sight of the sun melting into the horizon. Despite being free, this clean and spacious location can accommodate large crowds, making it an ideal place to witness nature's stunning spectacle.

sources.snippet: Kanyakumari is famous around the world for its most enchanting sunset and sunrise and what could be a better spot than Sunset View Point. Witness the Sun melting down in the horizon from the Sunset View Point which is reckoned as one of the topmost attractions of Kanyakumari. Apart from the spectacular view of sunrise and sunset at the confluence of three water bodies, one can savour the tranquil vibes of this serenading spot which is thronged by photographers and tourists from all over the world.
sources.shortName: Top 7 Attractions of Kanyakumari | Azure Waters & Picture Perfect Sunsets

sources.snippet: Sunset View Point is one of the most famous places for photographers in Kanyakumari. The sky turns into a colorful canvas during twilight, therefore the perfect time to capture breathtaking photos of sunsets. It is really amazing to watch the sun going down into the ocean and behind Thiruvalluvar statue with Vivekananda rock memorial on it in front.
sources.shortName: Discover Kanyakumaris Top Spots Through The Lens Of A Photographer

places.name: Sunset View Point

reviews.text:
Sunset at end of Indian mainland is an experience.
The view point is well maintained and ample car parking space .
Suggestions
An initial fees is collected and then you are guided to sunset view point
I will say look up sunset time, get  20 to 30 mins earlier and park before the sunset view point. You can walk from the first parking area to sunset view point in 10 to 15 mins. Parking near view point is charged additional.
Nicely maintained and lots of small shops too to try some food.

Super view point. We have played on the beach for some time and the heavy waves started so the police came and were told to come out of the beach. Beautiful experience and we took lots of pics and vids.
The location seems quite pleasant for a relaxing weekend; one can simply unwind and enjoy the atmosphere.üòâüòâ

places.generalDescription: Kanyakumari Beach, situated at the southernmost tip of the Indian Peninsula, offers breathtaking views of sunsets and moonrises over the confluence of three seas: the Indian Ocean, Bay of Bengal, and Arabian Sea. The rocky shoreline provides a picturesque setting for leisurely strolls while listening to the unique sound of waves. Visitors can savor local cuisine and explore nearby temples. It is best to visit during December and January to avoid extreme heat and humidity.

sources.snippet: Other major travel places at Kanyakumari include a host of beautiful beaches including Sothavilai Beach, Sanguthurai Beach and of course the main Kanyakumari Beach. Play with the waters of the ocean, take a stroll on the beaches as you witness the beautiful sun setting across the horizon-the beautiful beaches of Kanyakumari will always fill you with a sense of wonder. Away from the coastline Kanyakumari boasts of several other attractions for visiting including waterfalls, temples, churches, museums and historical monuments.
sources.shortName: Kanyakumari Tourism- Best Places to Visit in Kanyakumari

sources.snippet: Located at the confluence of 3 oceans, Kanyakumari beach lies at the southernmost tip of India and visiting this special tourist place of Kanyakumari in itself is a resplendent feeling. Besides, the stunning beach is famous for its spectacular vista of sunrise and sunset. Being the meeting point of three oceans, the tides at the beach are high and turbulent but that is not deterring enough as the geographical positioning is a high point for all the travellers.
sources.shortName: Top 7 Attractions of Kanyakumari | Azure Waters & Picture Perfect Sunsets

sources.snippet: Located in the southernmost part of India, Kanyakumari beach with its beautiful hue-changing beaches, the confluence of three water bodies: Bay of Bengal, Indian Ocean, and the Arabian Sea. Miraculously, here you can see that the water of three seas does not mix, you can distinguish between the turquoise blue, deep blue, and sea green waters of the three seas, though the colors keep changing with
sources.shortName: 26 Best Places to visit in Kanyakumari | Top Tourist Attractions

sources.snippet: Situated at the confluence of the three oceans namely, the Indian Ocean, Bay of Bengal, and the Arabian Sea this picturesque beach features amongst the most prominent places to see in Kanyakumari. Having a rocky surface, it is unsuitable for swimming, however, you can splash in the waves for some fun family time. The beach is appropriate for revelling in the beautiful views around.
sources.shortName: 5 Best Places to visit in Kanyakumari

sources.snippet: The unique aspect about Kanyakumari Beach is that here three big water masses meet i.e., Arabian Sea, Bay of Bengal and Indian Ocean. These confluences offer breathtaking sights particularly during sunrise and sunset seasons. Photographers can capture the golden reflections of sunlight on the water, the changing colors of a sundown sky and shapes of fishing boats in the distance.
sources.shortName: Discover Kanyakumaris Top Spots Through The Lens Of A Photographer

sources.snippet: Kanyakumari Beach or Cape Comorin Beach is one of the mesmerizing places to visit in Kanyakumari. Situated at the southernmost part of the Indian peninsula at the confluence of the three major water bodies, the pristine beach is a traveler's paradise. The golden sand beach at the banks of the glittering sea waters allures tourists from all across the world.
sources.shortName: 25 Places to Visit in Kanyakumari, Tourist Places & Attractions

sources.snippet: Kanyakumari beach also known as the  Cape Comorin beach is a major sightseeing and pre-wedding shoot destination of Kanyakumari and Tamil Nadu. Don‚Äôt think Kanyakumari is just all about religious sites, it also has some of the major mesmerizing beaches of the country. Kanyakumari beach is known for its multicolored sand and alluring sunrises and sunsets.

sources.snippet: Famous for its golden sands and breathtaking sunrise and sunset vistas is Kanyakumari Beach. Couples can enjoy a romantic setting on the beach thanks to its peaceful ambience and the sound of the waves lapping against the coast. Moreover, the beach is a fantastic location for natural moments and silly postures.

sources.snippet: Kanyakumari Beach is a splendid rocky beach to offers an awe-inspiring view of azure waters. The oscillations of waves against the rocks create a mesmerizing ambiance. Besides, the pristine golden sand gets covered with the enchanting hues of the rising as well as the setting sun.
sources.shortName: 10 Places to Visit in Kanyakumari: A Serene Getaway

sources.snippet: The beach is perfectly located at the confluence of the Indian ocean where the Arabian Sea and the Bay of Bengal meet. It is most certainly a gorgeous place with scenery to die for!. From the Kanyakumari beach, you can easily spot the lovely Swami Vivekananda statue.
sources.shortName: Top 20 Places to Visit in Kanyakumari: Best kanyakumari Tourist Places

sources.snippet: There are not only architectural and cultural places to see Kanyakumari, this town boasts of equally captivating scenic beauty too. Kanyakumari Beach, with its shimmering beach of multi-coloured sand is indeed a sightseeing place to visit in Kanyakumari.

sources.snippet: Pack some lunch and settle at Kanyakumari Beach, where you can see the sunrise and sunset. This beach is a meeting point for the Arabian Sea, Bay of Bengal and Indian Ocean!. With great vantage points to take selfies, this beach is Instagram goals.

places.name: Kanyakumari Beach

reviews.text:
üì£Kanyakumari Amman Temple: 4:30 AM to 12:30 PM, and again from 4:00 PM to 8:00 PM.
Vivekananda Rock Memorial: 8:00 AM to 4:00 PM, with ferry services operating during those hours.
Padmanabhapuram Palace: 9:00 AM to 12:30 PM, and again from 2:00 PM to 4:30 PM.
Vattakottai Fort: 8:00 AM to 5:00 PM.

Boats to the Vivekananda Rock Memorial in Kanyakumari typically operate from 8:00 AM to 4:00 PM. The ferry ride takes about 30 minutes to reach the memorial.
The visiting timing of Saint Thiruvalluvar Statue is from 8 AM to 4 PM. The charge for ferry services from the shore to the statue are Rs. 20 per person

Pricing in Kanyakumari
Ferry Type	Price Range (INR)
Standard M2M Ferries	500 - 800
Luxury M2M Ferries	1500 - 2500
Roro Ferry	700 - 1200
Ajanta Ferry	600 - 1000

The best time to visit Kanyakumari is between October to February as the temperature during these months usually drops and ranges between 20-30 degree Celsius.

Kanyakumari is open to visitors throughout the day. Specific opening and closing times apply to various attractions, but the general rule is that the main sites are open from early morning until late afternoon/early evening.

The statue is built as per Indian architectural styles, and is hollow inside. However, tourists are allowed to climb only up to the foot of the statue. Along with the Vivekananda Rock Memorial, the statue attracts millions of tourists annually and is one of the must-visit spots in your trip to Tamil Nadu.

Watching the sunrise at Kanyakumari Beach is truly breathtaking ‚Äì a must-see experience. However, the beach gets extremely crowded on weekends, making it a bit difficult to enjoy peacefully. Unfortunately, the beach was quite unclean and dirty, which took away from the overall experience.

Kanyakumari Beach is a mesmerizing destination where the blue waters meet the land's edge. With the sea on three sides, it offers breathtaking views, making it a unique coastal experience. The beach is safe for bathing, allowing visitors to enjoy the refreshing waves. Changing rooms are available, ensuring convenience for travelers. As the southernmost tip of India, this location holds special significance and provides a spectacular horizon where the ocean seems endless. A must-visit spot for anyone seeking beauty and tranquility by the shore.

places.generalDescription: The View Tower in Kanyakumari offers a stunning panoramic view of the coastal area, with its helical pedestrian ramp providing an elevated vantage point above the water. Situated near the Kumari Amman temple, Vivekananda Rock Memorial, and Thiruvalluvar statue, this five-storey circular tower is equipped with telescopes for observing these attractions as well as the sea.

sources.snippet: The view tower offers an amazing experience of the sunrise and the sunset coupled with the scenic beauty of the ocean. Telescopes present at the tower bring you closer to the vicinity of the panoramic landscape. You can watch the majestic statues of Swami Vivekananda and Thiruvalluvar hailing high above the mighty sea waters.
sources.shortName: 25 Places to Visit in Kanyakumari, Tourist Places & Attractions

sources.snippet: Interestingly, the Kanyakumari View Tower gives you the view of the exquisite sunrise and sunset. Imagine a breathtaking view as such while you enjoy the calming breeze of the ocean. Doesn't that make you want to pack your bags instantly and head down south?.
sources.shortName: Top 20 Places to Visit in Kanyakumari: Best kanyakumari Tourist Places

Worth the nominal entry fee of ‚Çπ15 for adults and ‚Çπ5 for kids. A must-visit spot for those exploring Kanniyakumari's natural beauties

places.generalDescription: The Thiruvalluvar Statue is a monumental 40-meter-high statue and pedestal located on a small island near the Vivekananda Rock Memorial in Kanyakumari. It is dedicated to the eminent Tamil poet and philosopher, Saint Thiruvalluvar, who composed 1330 profound seven-worded couplets known as Thirukkural. This work emphasizes virtues such as duty, kindness, wealth, charity, gratitude, and love for all classes of people in society.

sources.snippet: A 133 ft tall stone sculpture of the greatest Tamil poet and philosopher, Valluvar is one of the must-visit tourist attractions of Kanyakumari. Opened to the public in 2000, the Thiruvalluvar Statue stands on a three-tier pedestal that is etched with 38 chapters of Thirukkural which was the first book written by the poet, Thiruvalluvar. Despite its massive dimensions and weight of 7000 tons, the statue was swallowed by the tidal turbulence during the Tsunami in 2004 but the statue was restored to its original glory as it is considered to be the landmark of Kanyakumari.
sources.shortName: Top 7 Attractions of Kanyakumari | Azure Waters & Picture Perfect Sunsets

sources.snippet: Standing proudly in the middle of 3 seas, this Grand statue is made in the honor of the greatest Tamil poet and philosopher Saint Thiruvalluvar. This 133 feet high sculpture is known for its grand architecture and resemblance of Nataraja (Lord Shiva) and is the biggest symbol of various verses and teachings of Saint Thiruvalluvar. Surrounded by glittery blue water from all sides, this is really a super location for your Pre-wedding shoot.
sources.shortName: Aesthetic Pre Wedding Photoshoot in Kanyakumari

sources.snippet: Beside Vivekananda Rock Memorial stands the mighty Thiruvalluvar Statue. This statue, dedicated to one of Tamil Nadu's greatest poets and philosophers, Thiruvalluvar, measures up to 133 feet tall quite impressive!. Different angles can be used by photographers to capture the grandeur of the statue, especially during sunrise and sunset when light and shadow play a significant role in adding depth within images taken at that moment .
sources.shortName: Discover Kanyakumaris Top Spots Through The Lens Of A Photographer

sources.snippet: As you visit the Vivekananda Rock Memorial, adjacent to it, you will find the beautiful structure built of Tamil poet and philosopher, Thiruvalluvar. They have constructed a pedestal 38 ft high as a symbolic gesture to celebrate the 38 chapters of virtue penned in the book Tirukkural, by Thiruvalluvar in the field of literature. Meanwhile, the statue is 133 ft high to embody the 133 chapters of the book.
sources.shortName: Top 20 Places to Visit in Kanyakumari: Best kanyakumari Tourist Places

sources.snippet: Dedicated to the accomplished philosopher and poet Thiruvalluvar, this beautiful statue finds itself on a small island near Kanyakumari. Thiruvalluvar was the author of a legendary work in the world of Literature, Tirukkural, the classic Tamil text. In his devotion, the work for the statue started in 1990 and continued till 1999, during the year in which the figure finally got completed.
sources.shortName: 26 Best Places to visit in Kanyakumari | Top Tourist Attractions

sources.snippet: The massive 133 feet tall statue is of the Saint Poet Thiruvalluvar, who was considered to be one of the greatest Tamil poets in India. Thiruvalluvar Statue is one of the biggest in Asia and was unveiled on the 1st of January 2000. The pedestal of the statue is artistically designed and is decorated with 10 elephants that signify the various directions.
sources.shortName: Top 5 Places To Visit In Kanyakumari

sources.snippet: The pedestal of the statue is of 38 feet height and the statue over it is 95 feet tall with a grand total of 133 feet for the entire sculpture. The 3 tier pedestal known as Atharapeedam is surrounded by an artistic Mandapa with 38 feet height. To help the tourists to worship the holy feet of Thiruvalluvar 140 steps are constructed inside the Mandapa.
sources.shortName: 35 Best Places to Visit in Kanyakumari, Things to Do & Sightseeing (2024)

sources.snippet: Dedicated to Tamil poet and accomplished philosopher, Thiruvalluvar, this beautiful statue traces itself on a small island near Kanyakumari. As a memoir to him, the work for this statue started in 1990 and continued till 1999, and finally got completed in the same year. The statue stands as tall as 133-feet and is perched upon a 38-foot pedestal.
sources.shortName: 5 Best Places to visit in Kanyakumari

sources.snippet: A towering statue of the great Tamil poet and philosopher Thiruvalluvar stands on a smaller neighboring rock, just off the coast of Kanyakumari. The foundation stone was laid in 1979 and the work was completed 20 years later, in 1999. Ferries to Vivekananda Rock Memorial stop at the Thiruvalluvar statue afterward if the tide permits.
sources.shortName: Top Things to Do in Kanyakumari, Tamil Nadu

sources.snippet: No Kanyakumari tour is complete without visiting the majestic statue of Saint Thiruvalluvar. Built by Indian sculptor Dr. V. Ganapati Sthapati, this 133 feet long statue of great saint, poet and philosopher Thiruvalluvar, amid the vast spread of ocean presents a captivating view. This sky touching statue weighs around 7000 tonnes.
sources.shortName: Places to visit in Kanyakumari

sources.snippet: At a little island off the coast of Kanyakumari is a memorial to the great philosopher and poet Thiruvalluvar. Whenever we talk about the famous Kanyakumari spots, this statue often comes up as the top place to visit. The monument, which stands on a 38-foot pedestal, can be seen from quite a distance due to its 133-foot height.
sources.shortName: 21 Places to Visit in Kanyakumari in 2024

sources.snippet: The 133-foot-tall Thiruvalluvar Statue honors the well-known Tamil poet and philosopher. With the water as a backdrop, the monument provides a magnificent location for engagement photos. The gorgeous landscaping in the vicinity offers a variety of viewpoints for artistic photos.

sources.snippet: The Thiruvalluvar Statue is placed in a small island about 400 m from the coastline. The statue of one of the greatest Tamil Poets was erected by the then Chief Minister of Tamil Nadu Mr. M. Karunanidhi. The whole artwork is a massive structure standing about 133 ft tall.

sources.snippet: The awe-inspiring stone-carved statue of Thiruvalluvar (Tamil literature genius) will blow your mind. The spectacular Thiruvalluvar Statue stands beside the Vivekananda Rock Memorial. It is a grand architectural marvel with a whopping 38-feet high pedestal.

sources.snippet: The Thiruvalluvar Statue stands at the southern tip of India. It is a tribute to the Tamil poet Thiruvalluvar and his works. This impressive structure towers 133 feet high and is a sight to behold in Kanyakumari.

sources.snippet: This huge 133 feet statue of Tamil poet Thiruvalluvar is a must-see. With the pedestal decorated with 10 elephants and the intricate architecture, this statue‚Äôs cultural significance is massive.

places.name: Thiruvalluvar Statue

reviews.text:
I recently visited the Thiruvalluvar Statue in Kanyakumari, and it was an unforgettable experience. The statue is located on a small island surrounded by the sea, and now there's a newly built glass sea bridge that connects the Vivekananda Rock Memorial and the Thiruvalluvar Statue. Walking on this bridge was one of the highlights of my trip. You can see the ocean below your feet, and it gives you a thrilling and beautiful view of the surroundings.

The whole area is very clean and well-maintained. The strong sea breeze made the environment feel fresh and relaxing. It was really peaceful to stand near the statue with the wind blowing and enjoy the sound of the waves all around. The scenery is stunning, especially the view of the three oceans - the Bay of Bengal, Arabian Sea, and Indian Ocean - meeting at this point.

The Thiruvalluvar Statue itself is grand and inspiring, honoring one of Tamil Nadu's greatest poets and philosophers. The peaceful surroundings, combined with the majestic statue and the exciting walk on the sea bridge, created a perfect mix of nature, culture, and adventure.

If you're planning a visit to Kanyakumari, I highly recommend coming early in the morning or near sunset to fully enjoy the view, wind, and light. The sea bridge adds a new dimension to the experience - it's safe, exciting, and offers fantastic photo opportunities.

Great place, need to take government operated boats for the to and fro journey from kanykumari to the statue. It's around 80 Rs to take the boat ride. By giving 300Rs fast moving line can be utilised. Nice scenic place. Try avoiding peak noon time. There is glass bridge connecting between the statue and the meditation centre which is also an attraction.

Kanyakumari is a truly mesmerizing place where nature, history, and spirituality blend beautifully. Watching the sunrise and sunset over the ocean from the same spot is a unique and unforgettable experience. The Vivekananda Rock Memorial and Thiruvalluvar Statue are both iconic landmarks worth visiting - peaceful, inspiring, and scenic.

The confluence of the Arabian Sea, Bay of Bengal, and Indian Ocean is stunning to witness. The town is clean, the locals are warm and welcoming, and there's a calm spiritual vibe everywhere. Street food is great too, especially the fresh coconut water and local snacks.

Highly recommended for anyone looking to unwind, explore Indian culture, or just enjoy coastal beauty. I'd definitely love to return!
